history.summary:
Tech leader in a team of the shopping department.

• Qwant:
Based and designed in Europe, Qwant is a search engine which protects its users freedoms and ensures that the digital ecosystem remains healthy. Two keywords: privacy and neutrality. The website processes over 10 million search requests per day and over 50 million individual users a month worldwide.

In charge of the Parallel Processing department in the team that develops the Xilopix search engine's core.

Developed from scratch a distributed computing framework and a distributed web crawler/scraper.

• Xilopix:
Founded in 2008, Xilopix develops the Xaphir French search engine that provides users a new search experience allowing them to refine their search results an iterative (and tactile) way. The team develops it's own robot to crawl the web, extract analyze and index it's content. Results are displayed to users focussing on privacy and content diversity.
highlights: Test units, Continous integration, Code review

history.summary:
Worked in a team that deals with High Performance Computing, administrate and improve the Grid'5000 platform (www.grid5000.fr).

• Grid'5000:
Scientific instrument designed to support experiment-driven research in all areas of computer science related to parallel, large-scale or distributed computing and networking.
The infrastructure of Grid'5000 is geographically distributed on different sites hosting the instrument (10 in 2011). It is composed of more than one thousand machines dispatched on about 30 clusters.

Worked on the Kadeploy3 software in a team that deals with High Performance Computing and in collaboration with the Grid'5000 (www.grid5000.fr) administration team.

Continued the development of the software that is in production on the Grid'5000 platform since 2009.

• Kadeploy3:
Deployment solution for cluster and grid computing. Set of tools for cloning, configuring and managing  cluster nodes. Deploying systems on hundreds of nodes in a few minutes without any intervention of the system administrator.
highlights: Parallel programming, REST APIs, System daemons

history.position: Junior Software Engineer - High Performance Computing
history.summary:
Worked on the Distem software in a team that deals with High Performance Computing.

Developed from scratch the software that is controlled through a web API (REST).

• Distem:
Transformation of an homogeneous cluster into an experimental platform where nodes have diﬀerent performances and are linked together through a complex network topology. Breaking down physical resources performances.
highlights: Traffic shaping, Linux Kernel, tc, cpufreq

history.summary: Reinforcement learning of a complex task by splitting it into several sub-tasks. Simultaneous improvement of motion and sensing skills of the agent. Practical application and testing on a robot.

history.employer: Direction Régional de la jeunesse, des sports et de la cohésion sociale (DRJSCS)
history.summary: Needs analysis, conception and development of a generic training management tool for professional sportsmen.
highlights: PHP, MySQL, CakePHP, HTML, CSS, Javascript

history.summary: Total reforging of a  of a billing software package. Design of a new database, duplicate fields detection, migration script (tens of thousands refs).
Build a firewall rules migration system: firewall files parsing, common abstract syntax tree representation, rules integrity checking, rules simplification, firewall file generation.
Setting up a secure networking infrastructure (web services, mail, LDAP) using free softwares. Benchmarks and comparison with a proprietary-software based solution.

history.institution: North East Wales Institute of Higher Education
